title: Why did the early human need tools? - Quora

response.answer_text: Early human needed tools to fulfill their different purpose.As tools were important part of their life,for making fruits and vegitation easily useful and eatable.They used different kind of rocks tools for cutting,butchering,hunting and to cut tree branches for making shelter.They used spares,arrows, sharpened rock tools,antlers for hunting large and small animals. As a student of Anthropology I read that tools were very helpful for their dwelling.They also used tools for their safety from predators.wid the passage of time they learnt how to used tools for farming and making house for living.They learn to use tools for weaving and made clothes. In fact tools improve the quality of life of early humans and made modern humans advance as today's modern peoples are.

They didn't “need” tools. They just happened to had started using rocks, and stones, and sticks to do something and that behaviour, because it had some advantage in survival and reproduction, stayed. And later it got refined further and further.
